This position is part of DigiBC's Work Placement Pilot Program, which supports post-secondary students by providing experiential learning opportunities in animation, video, games, visual effects, and XR. As a part of this program, participating students will benefit from customized orientation workshops, e-learning resources, mentoring support, and the opportunity to start building their own professional network in the creative technology industry.

This position is open to students who are Canadian Citizens, Permanent Residents, or Protected Person as defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.


FUNDING RESTRICTION TO ELIGIBILITY
This co-op position is partially funded by the DigiBC Creative Technology Work Placement Pilot Project and you must meet the qualifications of this grant in order to qualify for this co-op position. Grant qualifications include:

You are a Canadian Citizen, a Permanent Resident or a Protected Person as defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act;
You are registered or enrolled at a Canadian post-secondary education institution and are able to provide proof of full-time or part-time enrolment during placement; and
You are legally entitled to work in Canada

International students do not qualify.

About Codename:

Codename Entertainment is an award-winning video game studio located in Victoria, BC. We're a passionate group of gamers who love making games and having fun in the process! We stream 20+ hours of content on Twitch each week, showcasing our games and creating an engaging and positive community for our players.

As a co-op student with us, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to the development of one of our games from day one, providing you with a hands-on learning experience of what it's like to work in the fast-paced world of indie gaming.

Work Term:

4-month work term for Spring/Summer 2025, with the possibility of extension

Work Schedule:

Monday to Friday, 35 hours per week

Work Location:

Onsite at our Victoria office

Salary Range:

$3,600/month (work terms 1 or 2)

$3,800/month (work terms 3 or 4)

Job Title: Co-op Game Content Developer & Scripter

About the Role:

As a Co-op Game Content Developer & Scripter, you'll be a key contributing team member to our longest running live service game Bush Whacker 2. You'll be responsible for producing content and creating features within the game. You'll work with our JSON based scripting and action system to create interesting interactive experiences for our players. You'll be working on laying down world areas within the game, including terrain, doodads, characters, and quests.

Qualifications:

As a qualified candidateâ€¦

You have experience with game programming in an object oriented programing language

You're highly creative and have a desire to create interesting game content

You're a self-starter with the ability to work with minimal direction

You have strong conceptual, production, and communication skills

You're logical and have strong problem-solving skills

You're passionate about games! (Bonus points if you've played one of our games!)

Additionally, any examples of level creation or other game content creation are considered a big plus and we welcome you to include them in your application.

Funding:

This co-op position is partially funded by the DigiBC Creative Technology Work Placement Pilot Project (https://wpp.digibc.org), which supports post-secondary students by providing experiential learning opportunities in animation, video, games, visual effects, and XR. As a part of this program, participating students will benefit from customized orientation workshops, e-learning resources, mentoring support, and the opportunity to start building their own professional network in the creative technology industry.

You must meet the qualifications of this grant in order to qualify for this co-op position. Grant qualifications include:

You are a Canadian Citizen, a Permanent Resident or a Protected Person as defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act;

You are registered or enrolled at a Canadian post-secondary education institution and are able to provide proof of full-time or part-time enrolment during placement; and

You are legally entitled to work in Canada

International students do not qualify.

What to Include in your Application:

Tell us about your love for gaming, what you've been working on, and why you would be a good fit for this role by including the following in your application:

Cover letter

Resume

Transcript

Portfolio of creative projects
